main event: On November 8, 1952, Lt. Albert F. Hadford, USAF, reported observing a dark, round object moving at an estimated speed of 600-800 mph over a range, which disappeared into cloud cover after approximately 10 seconds.
interesting points: The object was unresponsive to radio communications., The estimation of the size was based on the time of observation., The incident occurred during a troop training mission., Hadford reported the object as a large trace to the crew chief., The sighting was documented in a Project Blue Book report.
witnesses: Lt. Albert F. Hadford and crew
